author: dlr
msg: * notes/l10n-problems
Per message from Nicolás, added more requirements for server-side
L10N.

author: dlr
msg: * notes/l10n-problems: Linked to possible server-side impl.

author: dlr
msg: * notes/l10n-problems
A followup to r14783 removing a duplicate requirement from the I18N
section, and tweaking the formatting of items in the Server section.

author: dlr
msg: * notes/l10n-problems
Noted gotcha about setting env vars like LANG on Windows.  Talked a
little more about the deficiencies of setlocale().  Noted that the
current consensus seems to be that gettext will need to be replaced
with an alternate implementation on the server side, and discussed
specifics of the requirements for such an implementation.
Extrapolated the existing historial notes for server message
localization.
Some of this information was gathered during discussion with Erik
Hülsmann and Peter Lundblad.  Any errors are my own.  Additions to
these notes are open for discussion, and feedback is very welcome.

author: blair
msg: Fix a Perl variable scoping bug.
Patch by: Jim Paris <jim@jtan.com>
* contrib/client-side/svn_load_dirs.pl.in
(safe_read_from_pipe):
The $openfork_available variable in global scope is never properly
initialized because its declaration comes after the script's
'exit 0;' line.  Move the declaration into the function.  This bug
resulted in /bin/sh being used when it doesn't need to be.
